title: U2 1987-10-09 Syracuse Soundboard (Apple Lossless)
description:
Another fine recording brought to you by www U2unes com
===================================================================================

Syracuse Soundboard 
Joshua Tree Syracuse, New York 
09 October 1987 
(51:34) 
(50:35) 

Disc 1: 
1. All You Need Is Love (PA) 
2. Where the Streets Have No Name 
3. I Will Follow 
4. Trip Through Your Wires 
5. I Still Haven&#039;t Found What I&#039;m Looking For 
6. MLK 
7. The Unforgettable Fire 
8. Exit 
9. In God&#039;s Country 
10. Sunday Bloody Sunday 
11. Help 
12. People Get Ready 

Disc 2: 
1. Bad (fades in) 
2. October 
3. New Year&#039;s Day 
4. Pride (In the Name of Love) 
5. Star Spangled Banner/Bullet the Blue Sky 
6. Running to Stand Still 
7. With Or Without You 
8. 40 
9. Outtro 

NOTE (from Mike&#039;s U2 Trading run by Mike Duchek): 

Scott Zumsteg (Taper): 
This is my version of Syracuse which is the same source I had for Denver and Tempe. 
This originally came off a sony crew VHS video where just the audio portion was put to 
DAT. I have always had this version so I dont know how it differs to others. Mine cuts in 
the last minute of "With or Without You". This tape has a little more high end than Los 
Angeles but also a little bit more background mic noize as since it was being used simply as 
a prop for the lighting guys, not a ton of effort was done by sony to make a a1 mix of it. 

Mike Duchek: 
Scott&#039;s version, while being the best in terms of sound quality, was however incomplete 
(see above) and played too fast. Another version I had, "JT Syracuse" played at the right 
speed and was complete, so I decided to fix Scott&#039;s version, and add the missing portion 
where Scott&#039;s cuts out.  I would rate Scott&#039;s version as A Soundboard and JT Syracuse at 
B+/A-. I first corrected the speed, then added the last part of the show where it faded 
out. I did no other remastering. This should therefore be the best version of this show out 
there. 

CT&#039;s notes: I got these FLAC&#039;s directly from Mike without a CDr gen in between.
